page.title: 03LODDISWELL - HOUSES
page.content: Many council houses, mainly semi detatched, were built after the 1939-1945 war. These, like most of the post war houses, were built of concrete block construction, rendered and painted, usually white. Some of these council houses have recently been bought by the tenants and many improvements have been made, with replacement windows and doors being fitted. Near these houses are a number of attractively designed bungalows for old people. In Fore Street are two brick houses but this is unusual in Loddiswell. Most of the older houses are built in the attractive local stone, probably quarried only a short distance down the hill. There are only about four thatched cottages now left in the village.
